lines.value: world renowned composers of the 20th century included alexander scriabin igor stravinsky sergei rachmaninoff sergei prokofiev and dmitri shostakovich
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: russia has produced some of the greatest pianists anton rubinstein vladimir horowitz and vladimir ashkenazy are among the all time greats

lines.value: russian composer tchaikovsky created famous ballets such as the nutcracker
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the impressario sergei diaghilev was responsible for the development of ballet in the early 20th century with the ballets russes
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: dance companies at the mariinsky theatre and the bolshoi ballet produced many famous dancers
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: russians have contributed many famous works of literature
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: alexander pushkin is considered a founder of modern russian literature
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he was a poet from the 19th century
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: other famous poets and writers of the 19th century were anton chekhov mikhail lermontov leo tolstoy nikolai gogol he was born in what is now ukraine but during his lifetime ukraine was a part of russia ivan turgenev and fyodor dostoyevsky
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: tolstoy and dostoyevsky are considered by many people to be two of the greatest novelists ever
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: three russians won the nobel prize for literature in the 20th century boris pasternak 1958 mikhail sholokhov 1965 and aleksandr solzhenitsyn 1980

lines.value: mikhail bulgakov's the master and margarita was also a novel of the highest quality
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: soccer ice hockey and basketball are among the most popular sports

lines.value: boxing gymnastics weightlifting and tennis are also popular sports
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: track suits are popular clothing items for many russians
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: sports people to gain world fame include former tennis world number one maria sharapova who has won three grand slam titles and was the world's highest paid female athlete in 2008

lines.value: since the 1952 olympic games soviet and later russian athletes are in the three in gold medals collected at the summer olympics

lines.value: the 1980 summer olympic games were held in moscow while the 2014 winter olympics were hosted in sochi
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: for the 2018 winter olympics which were held in pyeongchang south korea a lot of athletes could not compete because the international olympic committee found out they had been doping

lines.value: those who were were not caught doping were able to play in the 2018 olympics under the title of olympic athletes from russia and they took home two gold medals including one in ice hockey

lines.value: chess is the main intellectual sport in russia

lines.value: in the 20th century there were nine russian world chess champions more than all other nations combined

lines.value: the main religion in russia is the russian orthodox church

lines.value: christmas which means christ's mass ) is a holiday that is celebrated on december 25
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it is a worldwide cultural and commercial phenomenon
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: for two millennia people around the world have been observing it with traditions and practices that are both religious and secular in nature
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: christians celebrate christmas day as the birthday of jesus of nazareth a spiritual leader whose teachings form the basis of their religion
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: popular customs include exchanging gifts decorating christmas trees attending church sharing meals with family and friends and of course waiting for santa claus to arrive
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: christmas day has been a federal holiday in the united states since 1870
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the middle of winter has long been a time of celebration around the world
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: centuries before the arrival of the man called jesus early europeans celebrated light and birth in the darkest days of winter
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: many peoples rejoiced during the winter solstice when the worst of the winter was behind them and they could look forward to longer days and extended hours of sunlight
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in scandinavia the norse celebrated yule from december 21 the winter solstice through january
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in recognition of the return of the sun fathers and sons would bring home large logs which they would set on fire
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the people would feast until the log burned out which could take as many as 12 days
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the norse believed that each spark from the fire represented a new pig or calf that would be born during the coming year
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the end of december was a perfect time for celebration in most areas of europe
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: at that time of year most cattle were slaughtered so they would not have to be fed during the winter
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: for many it was the only time of year when they had a supply of fresh meat
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in addition most wine and beer made during the year was finally fermented and ready for drinking
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in germany people honored the pagan god oden during the mid winter holiday
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: germans were terrified of oden as they believed he made nocturnal flights through the sky to observe his people and then decide who would prosper or perish
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: because of his presence many people chose to stay inside
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in rome where winters were not as harsh as those in the far north saturnalia a holiday in honor of saturn the god of agriculture was celebrated
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: beginning in the week leading up to the winter solstice and continuing for a full month saturnalia was a hedonistic time when food and drink were plentiful and the normal roman social order was turned upside down
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: for a month slaves would become masters
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: peasants were in command of the city
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: business and schools were closed so that everyone could join in the fun
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: also around the time of the winter solstice romans observed juvenalia a feast honoring the children of rome
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in addition members of the upper classes often celebrated the birthday of mithra the god of the unconquerable sun on december 25
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it was believed that mithra an infant god was born of a rock
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: for some romans mithra's birthday was the most sacred day of the year
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in the early years of christianity easter was the main holiday the birth of jesus was not celebrated
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in the fourth century church officials decided to institute the birth of jesus as a holiday
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: unfortunately the bible does not mention date for his birth a fact puritans later pointed out in order to deny the legitimacy of the celebration
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: although some evidence suggests that his birth may have occurred in the spring why would shepherds be herding in the middle of winter pope julius i chose december 25
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it is commonly believed that the church chose this date in an effort to adopt and absorb the traditions of the pagan saturnalia festival
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: first called the feast of the nativity the custom spread to egypt by 432 and to england by the end of the sixth century
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: by the end of the eighth century the celebration of christmas had spread all the way to scandinavia
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: today in the greek and russian orthodox churches christmas is celebrated 13 days after the 25th which is also referred to as the epiphany or three kings day
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this is the day it is believed that the three wise men finally found jesus in the manger
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: by holding christmas at the same time as traditional winter solstice festivals church leaders increased the chances that christmas would be popularly embraced but gave up the ability to dictate how it was celebrated
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: by the middle ages christianity had for the most part replaced pagan religion
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: on christmas believers attended church then celebrated raucously in a drunken carnival like atmosphere similar to today's mardi gras
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: each year a beggar or student would be crowned the lord of misrule and eager celebrants played the part of his subjects
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the poor would go to the houses of the rich and demand their best food and drink
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: if owners failed to comply their visitors would most likely terrorize them with mischief
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: christmas became the time of year when the upper classes could repay their real or imagined debt to society by entertaining less fortunate citizens
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: christmas traditions are of several types
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: there are traditions of the church traditions which are public celebrations and traditions that are kept by families
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: these traditions are different in different times places cultures and even families
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the celebration of christmas is a very important time for churches
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: almost every church has special services or celebrations
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: here are some of the ways that churches celebrate christmas
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it is the custom in many churches to set up a crib or creche scene of the nativity or birth of jesus
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the first scene of this type was set up by st francis of assisi in the 13th century
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: they have been very popular in italy ever since then and the custom has spread to other countries
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: nativity scenes can be large with life sized statues or they can be tiny enough to fit in a matchbox
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: they are made of many different things including carved and painted wood brightly coloured ceramics pottery painted paper glued to boards and mixtures of material with clay wood cloth straw and metal used for different parts
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the advent wreath is a circle of leaves usually pine boughs ivy and holly with 4 or sometimes 5 candles in it which is hung up in a church
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the candles are lit on each sunday in advent and the central candle is lit on christmas morning
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: churches are often decked with green branches and leaves and many churches also have a christmas tree
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: a popular tradition in many churches is the carol service which is often lit only by candles
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the carol service generally has lots of singing and bible readings
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: there is a tradition in england which began in the temple church in london and has now spread to many other places for a service of nine lessons and carols
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the lessons are bible readings
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: some carols are sung by a choir and others by the choir and people the congregation
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: every year one of these services is recorded in a large english church often king's college chapel cambridge and is broadcast on radio and television to be enjoyed by people who love good music and carol singing but particularly for people who cannot go to a christmas service
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: many cities and towns celebrate christmas by putting up decorations
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: these may be banners and bunting which are strung from buildings or lampposts
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: they may be christmas lights which can also decorate buildings and street trees
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: many large cities put up a huge christmas tree in a public place such as those in trafalgar square in london times square in new york and martin place in sydney
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this is often combined with an appeal to the people of the city to give money or gifts to help the poor and needy
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in many cities the usual shopping hours are made longer before christmas so that workers have more time to buy christmas food and presents
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: shop windows are often decorated with christmas scenes with large department stores often having animated scenes to entertain children
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: shopping malls and big stores often have a santa claus who sits on a throne while children tell him what they want for christmas and have their photos taken
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: many towns hold christmas parades street entertainment and concerts
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: some towns have a tradition of carols with a choir and entertainers in the town hall while in australia and new zealand these concerts of christmas entertainment and carols are usually held outdoors in parks or even on beaches with families bringing picnics
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the arrival of santa claus at the end of the evening is accompanied by a firework display
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: a traditional part of christmas is the theatre entertainment
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this includes the performance of classical music such as handel's messiah as well as orchestral concerts and band recitals
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: pantomimes are often played at christmas and favourites include peter pan and wendy and cinderella
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: many children's movies are released during the christmas season
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: because many people feel very lonely hungry and sad at christmas many cities churches charities and service organisations try to help the poor and lonely by providing christmas food and gifts for poor families and christmas parties for people who are hungry or who are lonely and without any friends or family
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: family celebrations are often very different from each other depending on where a family comes from and the customs that have grown in particular families
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: most families think of christmas as a time to get together with other members of the family
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: people often travel from far away to be with other family members at christmas
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: those people who cannot travel often make long distance phone calls on christmas day
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: many people also see christmas as a time to reach out to others that they know might be lonely and invite them to dinner on christmas day
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: christmas is seen as a time for people of all ages to have fun together for cousins to get to know each other for grandparents to see their grandchildren and for the family to admire the babies that have been born during the year
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: big family parties are usually a time of joy but some families often talk about their disagreements and have big fights at christmas time
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: family traditions are very different
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: some families might all go off to church together to a carol service a midnight mass or a christmas morning service
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: some families are pulled out of bed very early by children who want to open their presents
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in other families presents are given on st nicholas day on christmas eve or not until after church on christmas morning
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the christmas feast might start on christmas eve with a special breakfast on christmas morning or at midday on christmas day
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: some families have a tradition of carol singing and might go around the streets to hospitals and other such places singing with members of their church
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: other families like to watch certain television programs together which might include carol services and the queen's message
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: some families use christmas as a time to play music and sing together or to read a favourite book such as a christmas carol by charles dickens
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in countries in the southern hemisphere a visit to the beach or a swim in a pool is often part of the christmas day tradition
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: christmas dinner usually eaten in the middle of the day is an important part of the family celebration
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the food differs from country to country and also from family to family
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in the northern hemisphere roasted meat and vegetables is generally the main course of the meal
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: often several types of meat are served which may include turkey ham roast beef or lamb
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: there are often several courses with special treats that are usually only eaten at christmas
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in english speaking countries the traditional dessert is christmas plum pudding
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: nowadays these are often bought from bakers but many people make their own to a family recipe
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the tradition came from the middle ages when the pudding was used to preserve some of the fruit from the autumn until the mid winter
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: a traditional pudding is baked six weeks before christmas and is left tied up in a cloth in a cool place
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: stirring the pudding is sometimes a family tradition with everyone making a wish as they stir
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: traditionally a silver coin would be stirred into the pudding to bring luck to the person who found it
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: nowadays most coins cannot be used because they taste horrible and may be poisonous
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: some families use old coins or silver charms
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: on christmas day the pudding must be boiled in a pot for several hours
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: when it is served the cloth is cut off brandy is poured onto the pudding and is set on fire before it is carried to the table
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: many families have a christmas cake or a special bread instead of a pudding or as well as a pudding
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: these are very different depending on the country but often have marzipan which is made from almonds and is traditional in many countries at christmas
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in france buche de noel or gingerbread men and women are decorated and hung on the christmas tree
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in scotland a pastry biscuit called shortbread is made and has become a popular tradition in many countries
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: a german tradition is pfeffernuss spiced cookies rolled in powdered sugar
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: other christmas food includes raisins sultanas ginger turkish delight almonds chocolates caramel toffee candy canes and oranges
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: many families also prepare mulled wine which is warmed with cinnamon and nutmeg or egg nogs a sweet drink made of milk sugar eggs nutmeg and sometimes alcohol
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in the southern hemisphere the traditional roast dinner is often replaced with cold cuts of meat and served with salads
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the first course might be prawn cocktail or a cold soup like borsch
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the plum pudding might be served with ice cream
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: white wine and beer are both served cold beer is kept in a refrigerator
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: christmas dinner may be served on the veranda or sometimes as a picnic
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in most homes when christmas is celebrated people set up a christmas tree in the house
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this old yuletide custom began in germany as the tannenbaum german for fir tree
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: these are traditionally evergreens the best type being the fir tree which does not shed its needles or lose its fragrance
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the tree may be a cut tree that is bought from a plantation or taken from the forest
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: artificial trees are sometimes preferred to real trees
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the christmas tree is decorated with lights shiny coloured balls sparkly tinsel and other ornaments
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: a wreath of leaves or pine is often put on the front door of a house as a sign of welcome
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: other plants that have special significance at christmas are holly which is used as decoration and mistletoe which is hung in the centre of a room
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the tradition is that people who meet under the mistletoe must kiss
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: many people decorate their homes at christmas time
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: these decorations and the christmas tree are generally inside but may be put where they can also be seen through a window by people passing by
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in the mid 20th century there grew up a custom for decorating the outside of houses as well
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: these decorations may be just a few lights around the porch or hundreds of lights and colourful christmas figures decorating the whole house and garden
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: some neighbourhoods hold competitions for the best decorated house and driving around the streets to look at them has become another family tradition
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the giving of gifts at christmas comes from several different ideas
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: one is that god gave his son jesus to the world at christmas
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: there is also the story of the wise men who came to the baby jesus with three gifts gold frankincense and myrrh
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: for many centuries it has been the custom for people to give small gifts at christmas and also to give generously to the poor and needy to help them through the winter
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: another tradition has become linked to this one and the result is the tradition of santa claus or father christmas as he is sometimes called and who is nowadays thought by many children to be the bringer of presents and happiness
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in the 4th century in a greek village that is now part of turkey there was a good man who would secretly given presents to the poor to help them
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he became a bishop and is called saint nicholas
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: over the centuries he became a very popular saint and lots of churches were named after him
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he was very popular in places where there were lots of sailors
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: one of those places was the netherlands
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in the netherlands and many other european countries presents are given on the feast of saint nicholas december 6
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: traditionally the presents are not big and are sometimes hidden or have a funny joke or poem that must be read
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in many towns of europe a man dressed in bishop's robes comes on a horse or in a boat acting as st nicholas
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: his name was often shortened to sante claus or santa claus in english
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in english speaking countries where presents are usually given on christmas day not december 6 santa claus or father christmas is usually thought of as coming on the night of christmas eve when his magic sleigh is pulled across the sky by reindeer and he comes into houses through the chimney or the front door
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: while in europe children put out their shoes for st nicholas the english tradition is to hang up stockings or long socks in front of the fireplace
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: santa claus would traditionally fill the socks or shoes with nuts raisins chocolates and an orange
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: nowadays children usually get much more expensive presents have their stockings filled with candy and or small toys and have the presents in a big pile under the christmas tree
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: another christmas tradition is the sending of christmas cards to friends and relatives
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: these contain warm greetings and may also have a letter telling all the things that have happened to the person or family during the year
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: harry potter and the philosopher's stone is the first book in the harry potter series written by jk rowling
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it was published in 1997 and a movie version was shown in theaters in 2001
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in the united states the book and movie are called harry potter and the sorcerer's stone
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this is the first book about harry potter so the author begins by setting the scene and introducing the reader to some of the characters
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: at the start rowling describes how in an ordinary suburb somewhere in an english town people are suddenly surprised to see witches and wizards in odd clothing riding on public buses and appearing at places where people would not expect to suddenly meet a wizard
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it is clear that something unusual has happened in the world of witches and wizards and those people who are normally quite secret are out and about enjoying themselves
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in this way rowling introduces the two worlds of her story the world of ordinary people called muggles and the secret world of the magic folk who usually keep to themselves
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: rowling then introduces the main character harry potter a little baby boy who is left on the doorstep of his aunt and uncle by an old wizard with a long white beard
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: when the reader next meets harry he has grown to be a boy of eleven living unhappily with his spiteful aunt cruel uncle and bullying cousin dudley
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: suddenly he is rescued from his misery by a huge half giant man with a great black bushy beard and a flying motorcycle
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: harry potter is a wizard without knowing it and the giant man rubeus hagrid has come to help him buy his books and get ready to go to school
lines.name: Simple English

lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it is hogwart's school of witchcraft and wizardry
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: on the long train journey north harry potter meets the two people who are to become his best friends ronald weasley and hermione granger
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: ron and hermione have very different characters
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: hermione who comes from muggle parents is very intelligent and talented
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: she is such a know it all and so bossy that the boys do not like her at first
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: ron on the other hand comes from an old family of wizards
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he is number six in a family of seven children
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he wears hand me down clothes and even his pet rat used to belong to his brother percy
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: ron knows all about harry potter
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the reason that ron and all the other people in the wizarding world know all about harry potter is that harry is famous without even knowing it himself
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the reason why he was left on the doorstep of his aunt and uncle is that both his parents are dead
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he is so evil that people are even afraid to say his name

lines.value: james warren jim jones may 13 1931 - november 18 1978 was an american preacher and religious leader
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: his church was called the people's temple
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it began as a christian church a member church of the disciples of christ but over time became a cult
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: jones and most of the members of his group died on november 18 1978 in guyana
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: jones died when he shot himself on that day after forcing most of the members of his group to drink poison
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in november 1978 us congressman leo ryan led a fact finding mission to jonestown to investigate allegations of human rights abuses
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: ryan's delegation included relatives of temple members don harris an nbc network news reporter an nbc cameraman and reporters for various newspapers
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the group arrived in georgetown on november 15
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: on november 17 ryan's delegation traveled by airplane to jonestown
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the delegation left hurriedly the afternoon of november 18 after temple member don sly attacked ryan with a knife
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the attack was thwarted and the visit ended
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: congressman ryan and his people took with them fifteen people's temple members who had expressed a wish to leave
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: at that time jones made no attempt to prevent their departure
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: as members of ryan's delegation boarded two planes at the airstrip jones red brigade armed guards arrived in a tractor pulled trailer and began shooting at the delegation
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the guards killed congressman ryan and four others near a twin engine otter aircraft
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: at the same time one of the supposed defectors larry layton drew a weapon and began firing on members of the party that had already boarded a small cessna
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: an nbc cameraman was able to capture footage of the first few seconds of the shooting at the otter
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the five killed at the airstrip were congressman ryan don harris a reporter from nbc bob brown a cameraman from nbc san francisco examiner photographer greg robinson and temple member patricia parks
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: surviving the attack were future congresswoman jackie speier then a staff member for ryan richard dwyer the deputy chief of mission from the us embassy at georgetown bob flick a producer for nbc news steve sung an nbc sound engineer tim reiterman a san francisco examiner reporter ron javers a san francisco chronicle reporter charles krause a washington post reporter and several defecting temple members.<
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: later that same day 909 inhabitants of jonestown 303 of them children died of apparent cyanide poisoning in and around a pavilion
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this was the greatest single loss of american civilian life in a non natural disaster until the september 11 2001 attacks
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: no video was taken during the mass suicide though the fbi did recover a 45 minute audio recording of the suicide in progress

lines.value: the united states senate is part of the united states congress which is small group of elected people who decide the laws of the country

lines.value: every us state elects two people to represent them in the us senate

lines.value: these people are called senators

lines.value: since there are 50 us states there are 100 senators

lines.value: senators only serve six years at a time and one third of them are picked every two years

lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: after 1913 all the people of the state chose their senators by vote

lines.value: in most cases both of these groups have to agree on the suggested law and the president has to sign it before it becomes a law

lines.value: the senate is the side of congress where every state has the same number of votes two
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this is different from the house of representatives where states with more people have more votes than states with fewer people

lines.value: this was decided during the time the united states constitution was written because small states like rhode island and delaware did not want the larger states to be able to decide everything

lines.value: also only part of the senate runs for election during elections

lines.value: for each state this means that after two elections to the senate during one election no one will be elected to the senate

lines.value: a still is a tool used to clean a liquid
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it does this by first boiling the liquid and turning it into a gas
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this gas is then cooled changing it back into liquid
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: stills get their name from the word distillation
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: distillation is the process of boiling and cooling a liquid to purify it
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: stills are most often used to create alcohol but they can also be used with any liquid
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: some examples are medicines and perfumes
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: there are two main types of stills pot stills and reflux stills
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in a pot still the pot like a large kettle holding the liquid is heated
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the hot gas is cooled in a simple neck or tube and collected
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: pot stills are used for making alcohol like whisky
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: a reflux still is much more complex
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it works with a continual flow of liquid going into the boiler and a continual flow of distilled liquid coming out
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the distilled liquid can also be put through the process several times which is why it is called a reflux still
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this allows for a more pure product and the person working the still can control the level of purity
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: reflux stills are used in the chemical and petroleum industries
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: spyware is a category of software for computers
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: spyware is malware that collects some data usually without the computer users knowledge
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: very often this data is then sent over the internet to someone else
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: very often this is used for marketing
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: spyware can also be used to steal data from computers
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: one kind is a keylogger which can see whatever you are typing
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: keyloggers can steal important information like passwords that you type
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the best protection is to get a program that protects against spyware
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: but be careful many websites that claim to have them are actually spyware not something to protect against it
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this method of installing spyware is called a trojan horse which is disguised as something useful but when it runs its keystroke logging sees what keys you press
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this makes it easy for the trojan operator to collect your passwords and important data and log into your accounts
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: spyware tracks your computer and uses some of the things on it
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this includes your files your downloads and usernames passwords for websites and programs there are spyware applications that are designed to enable users to spy on themselves rather than others

lines.value: catalonia (; ; ) is a spanish autonomous community
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it is south of the eastern pyrenees and has a northern border with france
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: catalonia declared independence on friday 27th of october 2017
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: since then it is an unrecognized state
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: catalonia is made up of four provinces barcelona tarragona girona () and lleida ().
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it has a population of over 7 million people
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in catalonia a large percentage of the people can speak catalonia's own language catalan while everybody or nearly everybody according to recent surveys is also able to speak spanish the latter being the most spoken language in catalonia
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: there also is a small autonomous territory within catalonia which borders with france on the north known in occitan language as val d'aran where some people also can speak a third language occitan
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: all three of these languages are official and recognised by the spanish constitution and the statute of autonomy of catalonia
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the capital city of catalonia is the city of barcelona which was home of the olympic games in 1992
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this city is on the mediterranean coast between costa del garraf and costa del maresme being very popular amongst tourists in summer whether foreign or national
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the catalan people have autonomy within spain
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this means they have their own local government their own police and some control over their own community
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in september 2005 the catalan parliament decided to call catalonia a nation in the statute of autonomy of catalonia approved in 2006 according to the spanish constitution which says that spain is a group of historical nationalities and regions
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: but this declaration has no judicial status whatsoever though as it only appears in the preamble to the law
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: catalonia is one of southern europes most prosperous regions mostly because industrialization began there earlier and took place faster than in other spanish territories above all the textile industry
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the region is also greener than southern spain as it gets more rain and also different kinds of crops are grown there
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: catalonia especially the north is much less hot than the rest of spain
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: on 27 october 2017 catalonia declared independence from spain after a vote in parliament but it has not been recognized by the international community

lines.value: tower bridge is in london it crosses the river thames near the tower of london
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it is a drawbridge which allows ships through the bridge deck when the deck is raised in the centre at an angle
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the north side of the bridge is tower hill and the south side of the bridge comes down into bermondsey an area in southwark
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: tower bridge is far more visible than london bridge which people often mistake it for
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: many tourists go to london to see the tower bridge
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it has its own exhibition centre in the horizontal walkway
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this gives one of the best vantage points in london
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the bascules are the surfaces raised to allow tall ships to pass through this happens about 900 times per year
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the bridge's decks bascules can be raised to 83 o from the horizontal
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the city of london corporation held a competition for the design in 1876
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: over 50 designs were entered and in 1884 horace jones and john wolfe barry's design was chosen
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: workers began to build the tower bridge in april 1886 and the bridge was opened in 30 june 1894
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in june 2012 the bridge was highlighted on the of queen elizabeth ii's diamond jubilee pageant on the thames
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the bridge is in length with two towers each high built on piers
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the central span of between the towers is split into two equal bascules or leaves which can be raised to an angle of 83 o to allow river traffic to pass
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the bascules weighing over 1100 tons each are counterbalanced to minimize the force required and allow raising in five minutes
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the bascules are raised by huge hydraulic pumps which were first powered by steam engines
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in 1976 these were replaced by oil and electricity
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the bridge is made from more than 11000 tons of steel and covered with cornish granite and portland stone
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the two side spans are suspension bridges each long with the suspension rods anchored both at the abutments and through rods contained within the bridge's upper walkways
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the pedestrian walkways are above the river at high tide
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: these walkways allow people to still cross the river even when the bridge is raised
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: they were closed in 1910 because not enough people used them but were reopened in 1982
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: aleister crowley 12 october 1875 - 1 december 1947 was a british mystic occultist writer poet mountain climber and nicknamed the wickedest man in the world
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he was an influential member in some occult organizations such as the golden dawn the a∴a∴ and ordo templi orientis o.t.o and is better known today for his occult books and papers
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he was bisexual
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: crowley also started a mystical philosophy known as thelema the abbey of thelema and revived the term magick
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: edward alexander crowley was born at 36 clarendon square in royal leamington spa warwickshire england between 11:00pm and 11:59 p.m on 12 october 1875
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in 1895 he went to trinity college cambridge after going to malvern college and tonbridge school
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in his three years at cambridge his father died and left him a large sum of money
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in december 1896 crowley took interest in occultism and by the next year he began reading books on alchemy and mysticism
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: a year later he published his first book of poetry aceldama and left cambridge only to meet julian l baker who introduced him to samuel mathers and the hermetic order of the golden dawn
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in november 1899 crowley bought boleskine house in foyers on the shore of loch ness in scotland
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: samuel mathers acting leader of the golden dawn organization acted as his early mentor in western magic
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: crowley lost faith in his mentor's abilities in 1900 but did not officially break with mathers until 1904
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: crowley died of a respiratory infection in a hastings boarding house on 1 december 1947 at the age of 72
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he had been addicted to heroin after being prescribed morphine for his asthma and bronchitis many years earlier
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: readings at the cremation service in brighton included hymn to pan and newspapers referred to the service as a black mass
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: aesthetics is a branch of philosophy
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it is the study of art and beauty
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: together with ethics it is part of axiology which is the philosophy of what people like
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: aesthetic philosophers ask what people like to look at hear feel smell or taste and why they like these things
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: aesthetic philosophers also ask if art has any value
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: for example they may ask if some art that nobody likes and that nobody wants is art at all or if it is something else
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: plato aristotle and immanuel kant are some important philosophers of aesthetics
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: one theory in aesthetics is called subjectivism
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: subjectivism says that each person has their own sense of beauty
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: so the only way of judging something's beauty is if people say it is beautiful
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: a common way of describing this is beauty is in the eye of the beholder
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: subjectivism also says for the same reason that something is art simply because someone says it is art
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this is backed up by the experience that even though people feel they find something beautiful they may not be able to explain why
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: many objectivist theories of beauty have been offered going from the ancient ideas of plato and aristotle e.g the golden mean which still have great appeal in their own way to neuroscience research into the brain's response to images and other sense information
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: at the moment even though we do not know what people are thinking brain scan technology can identify when people are responding pleasurably to images providing some clue as to how certain images affect some people
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: * aesthetics citizendium
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: a spin off may have the same people places themes or ideas as the original

lines.value: charon is a moon of the dwarf planet pluto
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it is half as wide as pluto and is much like the dwarf planet itself
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it was discovered many years after pluto
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it is named after charon in greek mythology a boatman who would carry the souls of dead people across the river acheron to the underworld
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: charon was found by astronomer james christy on june 22 1978 when he was looking at highly blown up picture of pluto on a photographic plate that taken a couple of months before
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: christy noticed that a slight bulge was able to be seen every now and then
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this finding was made public on july 7 1978
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: later the bulge was confirmed on plates dating back to april 29 1965
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: later observations of pluto were able to figure out that the bulge was due to a smaller body
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the orbit of the bulge fit in with pluto's rotation period which was already known from pluto's light curve
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: any final doubts were erased when pluto and charon entered a five year period of mutual eclipses between 1985 and 1990
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this happens when the pluto charon orbital plane is edge on as seen from earth which only happens at twice in pluto's 248-year orbital period
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it was very lucky that one of these intervals happened to occur so soon after charon's discovery
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: pictures showing pluto and charon as separate disks were taken for the first time by the hubble space telescope in the 1990s
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: later after a new technology called adaptive optics was discovered it was possible to see pluto and charon as separate disks using ground based telescopes

lines.value: although salt lake city is still home to the headquarters of the church of jesus christ of latter day saints lds church less than half the population of salt lake city proper is mormon today

lines.value: immigration of international lds members mining booms and the construction of the first transcontinental railroad initially brought economic growth and the city was nicknamed the crossroads of the west

lines.value: it was traversed by the lincoln highway the first transcontinental highway in 1913 and presently two major cross country freeways i 15 and i 80 intersect in the city

lines.value: lyndon baines johnson august 27 1908 - january 22 1973 was a member of the democratic party and the 36th president of the united states serving from 1963 to 1969
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: johnson took over as president when president kennedy was killed in november 1963
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he was then reelected in the 1964 election
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: his time as head of government had two chief parts his policies inside the country which included civil rights and caring for the poor and also his policies that were open to argument which resulted in the united states fighting the vietnam war
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: johnson was born in texas
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: his father was a politician who had worked for the texas state government
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: as a young adult he was a teacher
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he was elected to the house of representatives in 1937 then to the senate in 1948
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he won the senate election by just 87 votes
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in the senate johnson very quickly became powerful and in 1955 became leader of the senate and was the youngest to have ever held that position
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he started great programs for the public
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it helped that he knew the other senators well and could often persuade them to support his ideas
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in 1960 he ran for president but during the contest to see who the democrats would support he lost to john f kennedy
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: johnson was then selected by kennedy as the candidate vice president
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: kennedy narrowly won the election and johnson became vice president
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: like most vice presidents johnson did not like the job
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it gave him too little power
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: lyndon b johnson was well known as someone who could persuade other lawmakers in congress to pass laws
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: to gain more support for his ideas he often arm twisted other politicians meaning he would threaten them if they didn't agree with him
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: johnson took over as president after kennedy was assassinated
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he finished kennedy's term as president then in 1964 he ran for reelection and won easily against barry goldwater
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: johnson won 61.1% of the vote
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this is the highest percentage of the vote ever won by someone running for president since 1820
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: johnson began a war on poverty
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he created the great society a series of government programs intended to improve the living standards of the country
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: these programs include public broadcasting protecting the environment medicare health care for the elderly medicaid health care for the poor
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he supported civil rights for african americans and continued where kennedy left off in giving them freedom
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the voting rights act in 1965 gave the government powers to stop them from being denied the right to vote
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: compared to kennedy's weak relationship with congress johnson was able to convince politicians to support some of the same policies which they opposed under kennedy
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: at the same time johnson increased the united states involved in the vietnam war
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: johnson increased the number of soldiers in vietnam from 16000 to 500000 in order to stop the viet cong the communist rebels in south vietnam
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: as the years passed johnson became more and more unpopular as the war kept on going without an end in sight
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: by 1968 almost 1000 american soldiers were being killed in vietnam every month and the enemy still hadn't been defeated
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in march johnson said he would not run for reelection
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: johnson's time as president ended in january 1969
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he went back to texas to live his ranch in stonewall
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: johnson died at his ranch on january 22 1973 at age 64 after having a heart attack
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: johnson had a state funeral
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the final services took place on january 25
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the funeral took place at the national city christian church in washington dc despite the disaster in vietnam johnson is still thought of as being a good president by historians because of what he achieved with civil rights
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in 1973 the manned spacecraft center in houston was renamed the lyndon b johnson space center
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: a kernel is the central part of an operating system
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it manages the operations of the computer and the hardware most notably memory and cpu time
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: there are two types of kernels
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the kernel is the most fundamental part of an operating system
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it can be thought of as the program which controls all other programs on the computer
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: when the computer starts it goes through some initialization booting function such as checking memory
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it is responsible for assigning and unassigning memory space which allows software to run
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it provides services so programs can request the use of the network card the disk or other piece of hardware the kernel forwards the request to special programs called device drivers which control the hardware manages the file system and sets interrupts for the cpu to enable multitasking
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: many kernels are also responsible for ensuring that faulty programs do not interfere with the operation of others by denying access to memory that has not been allocated to them and restricting the amount of cpu time they can consume
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: operating systems commonly use monolithic kernels
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in linux for example device drivers are often made to be part of a kernel specifically loadable kernel modules
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: when a device is needed its extension is loaded and joined onto the kernel in other words making the kernel larger
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: monolithic kernels can make trouble when one of these drivers is faulty such as if a beta graphics driver is downloaded
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: because it is part of the kernel it often overrides the mechanisms that deal with faulty programs see above
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this can mean that the kernel and thus the entire computer can cease to function
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: if there are too many devices the kernel can also run out of memory causing a system crash or making the computer very slow
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: microkernels are a way of solving this problem
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in a microkernel operating system the kernel deals only with critical activities such as controlling the memory and cpu and nothing else
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: drivers and other functions that monolithic kernels would normally do within the kernel are moved outside the kernel where they are under control
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: instead of being an uncontrollable part of the kernel the beta driver is therefore no more unlikely to cause a crash than a beta web browser that is if a driver goes wrong it can simply be restarted by the kernel
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: unfortunately creating microkernel based operating systems is very difficult and there are no operating systems like these that are commonly used
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: minix is a microkernel operating system
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in mathematics a number can not be divided by zero
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: observe the problem is that a could be any number
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it would work if a were 1 or if it were 1000000000
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: 0/0 is said to be of indeterminate form for this reason because it has no single value
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: numbers of the form a/0 on the other hand where a is not 0 are said to be undefined this is because any attempt to define them will result in a value of infinity which is itself undefined
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: usually when two numbers are equal to the same thing they are equal to each other
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: that is not true when the thing they are both equal to is 0/0
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this means that the normal rules of maths do not work when the number is divided by zero
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it is possible to disguise a special case of division by zero in an algebraic argument
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this can lead to invalid proofs such as 1=2 as in the following with the following assumptions the fallacy is the assumption that dividing by 0 is a legitimate operation with 0/0 = 1
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: most people would probably recognize the above proof as incorrect but the same argument can be presented in a way that makes it harder to spot the error
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: for example if 1 is written as x then 0 can be hidden behind x x and 2 behind x+x
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the above mentioned proof can then be displayed as follows the proof above is incorrect because it divides by zero when it divides by x x because any number minus itself is zero
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in calculus the above indeterminate forms also come as a result of direct substitution while evaluating limits
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: if a computer program tries to divide an integer by zero the operating system will usually detect this and stop the program
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: usually it will print an error message or give the programmer advice on how to improve the program
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: division by zero is a common bug in computer programming
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: dividing floating point numbers decimals by zero will usually result in either infinity or a special nan not a number value depending on what is being divided by zero
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in geometry this infinity projective infinity is neither a positive or a negative number the same way that zero is neither a positive or negative number
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: computational complexity theory is a part of computer science
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it looks at algorithms and tries to say how many steps or how much memory a certain algorithm takes for a computer to do
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: very often algorithms that use fewer steps use more memory or the other way round if there is less memory available it takes more steps to do
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: many interesting algorithms take a number of steps that is dependent on the size of the problem
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: complexity theory also looks at how a problem changes if it is done for more elements
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: a problem of constant complexity class is the only class in which this is not true
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: a problem with constant complexity takes the same number of steps to complete no matter the size of the input or the number of elements it is computed on
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: broadcasting a message can be thought of as a problem of constant complexity
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: no matter how many people need to receive a message all can listen on to one single broadcast with no extra broadcasts needed
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: mowing the lawn can be thought of as a problem with linear complexity
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: mowing an area that is double the size of the original takes twice as long
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: suppose you want to know which of your friends know each other
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: you have to ask each pair of friends whether they know each other
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: if you have twice as many friends as someone else you have to ask four times as many questions to figure out who everyone knows
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: problems that take four times as long when the size of the problem doubles are said to have quadratic complexity
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this is often the complexity for problems that involve looking things up like finding a word in a dictionary
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: if the dictionary is twice as big it contains twice as many words as the original to compare to
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: looking something up will take only one step more
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the algorithm to do lookups is simple
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the word in the middle of the dictionary will be either before or after the term that needs to be looked up if the words do not match
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: if it is before the term needs to be in the second half of the dictionary
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: if it is after the word it needs to be in the first half
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: that way the problem space is halved with every step until the word or definition is found
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this is generally known as logarithmic complexity
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: there are problems that grow very fast
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: one such problem is known as the travelling salesman problem
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: a salesman needs to take a tour of a certain number of cities
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: each city should only be visited once the distance or cost of the travelling should be minimal and the salesman should end up where he started
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this problem has exponential complexity
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: there are n factorial possibilities to consider
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: adding one city from n to n+1 will multiply the number of possibilities by n+1
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: most of the interesting problems have this complexity
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: a clef is a sign at the beginning of a staff of music which makes it possible for the player to work out what the notes are
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the word clef is a french word meaning key
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the original latin word is clavis
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it is the key to understanding which notes should be played
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the staff or stave consists of five lines across the page
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the notes are placed on these lines and in these spaces
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the staff is only large enough to cover one and a half octaves of music a bit more with ledger lines
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: therefore different clefs are used for high music and for low music
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the treble clef is drawn by starting with a circle in the middle then going up round and straight down with a hook at the end
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the second line of the staff counting from the bottom goes through the middle of the treble clef's circle
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: a note on this line is a g this is why the treble clef is called a g clef
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the treble clef is used for high notes
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the notes higher than middle c can be written in the treble clef
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in piano music the right hand is usually written in the treble clef
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: music for instruments such as the violin flute oboe recorder trumpet and high singing voice are always written in the treble clef
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the alto clef is an example of a c clef
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the middle of a c clef points to middle c in the alto clef middle c is on the third line of the staff
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: viola music is written in this clef which is why it is also called the viola clef
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: alto trombone players also need to be able to read the alto clef
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the tenor clef is another c clef
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: middle c is on the fourth line up
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: tenor trombone players need to be able to read the tenor clef
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: cellists double bass players and bassoonists also need to read tenor clef when their music goes high
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the bass clef is normally used for the left hand in piano music
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: low instruments like the cello double bass and bassoon mostly read from the bass clef
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it is an f clef because the two dots are on either side of the fourth line up which is an f below middle c
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the choice of clef used depends on the music
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the music for a pianist's left hand may be written in the bass clef and the right hand notes may be in the treble clef
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in choral music the sopranos and altos sing from the treble clef the tenors usually sing from the treble clef but sounding an octave lower than written shown by a small 8 below the clef and the basses sing from the bass clef
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: for low bass intoments

lines.value: giuseppe verdi b
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: roncole near busseto 9 or 10 october 1813 died milan 27 january 1901 was an italian composer of operas

lines.value: verdi and richard wagner were the greatest composers of opera in the 19th century although they were completely different from one another
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: when verdi was a young man the most famous opera composers in italy were gaetano donizetti and vincenzo bellini who wrote in the bel canto tradition
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this meant that their operas had beautiful tunes which were written for singers to show off their voices even if what they sang did not suit the story
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: during his long life verdi changed opera so that it did not have to obey old fashioned rules
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he made the drama the most important thing and the music is there to help the drama that said verdi is most remembered for the power of his music
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the small village where verdi was born lies in the valley of the river po in the north of italy
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it was a poor district
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: his father was an innkeeper who had a small farm
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the young boy must have been very talented
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he was given a spinet which he kept all his life
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: at the age of 9 he often played the organ for church services in the village when the organist was away
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: a few years later he composed music for the orchestra in busseto
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: a man called antonio barezzi knew many important people and he helped verdi a lot
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: later verdi married a daughter of a friend
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: barezzi sent him to milan so that he could study but verdi had not been taught the piano properly and he did not get a place in the music conservatory
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he had some private lessons and learned a lot about opera as well as about literature and politics
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in 1839 he composed an opera oberto conte di san bonifacio which was performed in la scala] the world famous [[opera house in milan
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it is not one of his greatest operas but it helped him to become well known and he was asked to write three more operas for la scala
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: when his next opera was produced it was not a success the audience did not like it and they hissed and booed
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: there was also tragedy in his personal life at this time his two children and his wife all died
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: verdi managed to overcome his unhappiness in 1842 when he produced his opera nabucco
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this was a great success and made him world famous
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he started to work very hard composing two operas a year
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he not only had to write the music but organize all the people to perform it
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it was a huge workload
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: his opera ernani 1844 was one of the best from this period
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in 1847 he had another big success with macbeth
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this opera based on shakespeare's famous play is still one of the best loved of all operas
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he was becoming a success
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: for centuries italy had been a collection of several countries each with their own ruler

lines.value: in the 1850s there was a lot of political unrest in the country
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: verdi often wrote music for large choruses in his operas

lines.value: the words of these choruses were often about fighting for freedom and it was often thought that the songs were encouraging people to revolt
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the song va pensiero from his opera nabucco was about the hebrew slaves who were captive in babylon

lines.value: people chanted it in the streets with the words suitably changed

lines.value: verdi became a great national hero

lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: she had lived with another man and had three children so she felt that she was not good enough for verdi

lines.value: they eventually married in 1859

lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he moved back to busseto with her
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he continued to travel a lot but did not let his wife come with him leaving her behind in busseto where she was not happy because many people there did not like her
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: three more famous operas were written at this time rigoletto in 1851 and il trovatore the troubadour and la traviata both in 1853

lines.value: they are full of exciting drama in which the characters are very skilfully described by the music
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the music is not divided so clearly into recitative and aria like it had been for two centuries
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: instead the music is developing all the time the arias run straight into the following music
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he had a brilliant sense of drama but he often had to fight hard to stop producers making changes to what he had written
lines.name: Simple English

lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: his opera rigoletto was based on a story called le roi s'amuse by victor hugo
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the attempted murder of a king was not thought to be a suitable subject
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: verdi had to change the king into a duke in his story and make some other changes before the opera could be performed
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the story of his opera traviata based on a novel by alexandre dumas fils was also thought to be immoral
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: at the first performance the audience laughed because the heroine who is supposed to be dying of consumption was very fat
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: however the opera soon became enormously popular
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: verdi had become very famous by now and was asked to compose for the opera in paris
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he had to write operas in the french style operas with five acts and a ballet based on a serious story
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: none of the operas he wrote at this time for paris belong to his best works
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he was more inspired when writing for the italian theatres
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: simon boccanegra has a complicated plot but the characters are described beautifully by the music
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: un ballo in maschera the masked ball was about the murder of king gustav iii of sweden
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: again the censors did not like it and he had to change the story to a setting in boston which rather spoiled the story
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: major league baseball mlb is a professional baseball league in north america

lines.value: it also includes mlb productions and mlb advanced media which are in charge of major league baseball games on television and the teams and company web pages

lines.value: the teams play other teams in their own division the most and play very few no more than six games against teams in the other league

lines.value: if teams are tied at the end of a season and at least one of the tied teams cannot make the playoffs they will play an extra game or with more than one team involved a series of single games to decide which team(s will make the playoffs
