lines.value: transgender is a term used to describe people who may act feel think or look different from the sex they were assigned at birth
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: because the word transgender is used to cover a wide variety of people it is called an umbrella term
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: many different types of people think of themselves as transgender
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: different english speakers define words in different ways
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: for these reasons the term trans people is often used
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: some common definitions of the words used in this article are listed here
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: these are common ways but not agreed to by everyone
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: there are many groups who are included under the umbrella term transgender
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: some of the bigger groups are * intersex is a word for people who are born with both some male and some female biological traits
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: people like those who in modern western societies are now identified as transgender or transsexual have been documented in many cultures and for thousands of years
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: however only in the last century have science and medicine been able to meet some of the needs for bodily change of trans people who want to change their body
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: people who have traits that are different from the sex they are born with have been accepted in some societies both historically and now
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: for example some native american tribes accepted two spirit people
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: similarly a tongan person born with a male body who acts and dresses in a female way is known in the local dialect as a fakaleiti
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the hijra in india are born physically male but live as women including dressing and socializing as female
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in the past they used to castrate themselves and even remove the penis in order to urinate through a small hole
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: now with the arrival of western medicine many hijari choose to take hormone therapies and sometimes have sex reassignment surgery
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: many of these people still call themselves hijari but some now call themselves transsexuals or transgender women
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the role of hijari in society is complex and varied throughout all of india
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in western society there have often been people who have chosen to act and dress in a way that was not gender specific or was not that of the sex they were assigned at birth
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this is not the same as being transgender
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: cross dressing actors were very popular in the theatre of the late 19th century
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: an example of a transgender person is the 19th century military surgeon who was known as james barry
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it is now believed that barry was born female but disguised his sex all his adult life
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: barry's work which saved and helped thousands of lives by improving treatment of wounds to stop amputations would not have been possible as a woman because as a female he could never have attended medical school or entered the army
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: a 20th century example of a transgender person is jan morris a geographer explorer and journalist who began life as james morris
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: as james morris married and had children but felt female and eventually became jan morris
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: transgender people are not accepted in every society
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: they suffer discrimination violence and even murder
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: transgender people have fought for and have gained many rights and protections in some societies
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in many places the fight for transgender rights is associated with the fight for gay and bisexual rights
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: together these groups are sometimes described by the acronym lgbt for lesbian gay bisexual and transgender
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: however some transgender people do not want to be a part of the lgb lesbian gay and bisexual community as they may see themselves as heterosexual and not feel like they belong with gay or queer people and some lgb people do not want to be a part of the transgender community as they may be transphobic which means that they may have a fear or dislike of transgender people or they may not want heterosexuals to see sexuality and gender identity as the same thing
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: however gay and transgender people often have some of the same problems in society so many gay lesbian bisexual and transgender people try to work together to solve all of their problems
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: a 2012 study of british transgender people found that 84% had considered suicide
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: 55% had been diagnosed with depression
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: 33% had not been diagnosed with depression but thought that they had it in the past or at the time of the survey
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: 46% of the people who had self harmed had self harmed every day at some time in their lives
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: 38% of the transgender people had been diagnosed with anxiety
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: 53% had self harmed at some time in their lives
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: 44% had used antidepressants and 31% were using antidepressants
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: a study of 164 irish transgender people found that 80% per cent had also considered suicide
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: 40% of those had attempted suicide at least once
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: 44% had self harmed
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: transgender people who wish to take medicine and have surgery to change their bodies face several problems
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in order to change their bodies they must have doctors who are willing to help them and make the changes
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: they sometimes cannot do this because doctors will not help them
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: they may also not be able to do this because even if a doctor would treat them they may not be able to afford the medicine or surgery
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: but the declaration of montreal affirms that such medical care be provided for them by public health insurance
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: many transgender people do not like being labelled as having a disease or gender identity disorder
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in some places the government labels being transgender a disease
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: one of the international human rights laws of the yogyakarta principles principal 18 disagrees with any use of a medical disease label
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: however many transgender people depend on this diagnosis
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: some people can only get medical and surgical treatment paid for by their government if it is to treat a disease so if it is not considered a disease they will not get the medicines and surgery they need
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: also some laws protect transgender people from transphobia and discrimination
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in places that do not have these laws transgender people may only be protected under laws that protect people with diseases or disabilities so their condition needs to be labeled one of these
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: doctors do not agree on one way of viewing being transgender
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: some doctors view the condition as a birth defect that can easily be fixed others may not even recognize being transgender as a medical condition
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this argument still goes on in both the transgender community and in the medical community that treats them
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: about 50% of transgender people have been sexually assaulted
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: transgender people have problems with laws and regulations about sex
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: to be seen and treated as the sex they wish transgender people usually have to change their first name
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: they also may want to change their identity documents to say the correct sex
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: for example a transgender woman may wish to change her birth certificate or driving license to say her new female name and to say that she is a female
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: these changes can protect transgender people from discrimination
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: for example transgender people often have difficulty traveling because their appearance does not match their identity papers
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: these changes can also be necessary for transgender people to be allowed to marry their spouses in places where it is illegal for homosexual people to marry
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: these changes can even protect transgender people from a wide variety of violence
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: some transgender people are only recognized when their documents reveal them
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: being revealed as transgender can put people in danger because of transphobia fear and or hatred of transgender people
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: unfortunately in many places this is hard or impossible for transgender people to change their identity documents with or without undergoing genital surgery which is required in many places contrary to the definition of the yogyakarta principles
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this is changing however
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: recently the united kingdom passed the gender recognition act of 2004
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this act allows people to have their change of sex officially recognized without surgery
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: once changed they have all the rights privileges and responsibilities of their new gender
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the ford mustang is a very popular american sports car built by the ford motor company beginning in 1964
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the first cars were built in ford's dearborn michigan factory on march 9 of that year and the car was first shown to the public on april 17 at the new york world's fair
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it did not cost a lot of money but it was still very fancy and looked like a much more expensive car
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: people could order their mustang with many options and body styles such as a convertible 2+2 fastback or coupe
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: many different engines were available from the 170 cid six cylinder to some of ford's biggest and most powerful v 8 engines in later years
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this meant car buyers could have a mustang that saved gas or a more powerful and fast car
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: more than one million mustangs were sold in only two years
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the mustang is still being sold today and is still very popular
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it was so popular and so different when it was introduced that the mustang and other cars from other makers which looked like the mustang were given the name ponycar the so called 1964 1/2 mustang was designed by joe oros and dave ash of ford's mercury division was based on another ford car the falcon and was proposed by ford's president lee iacocca
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the falcon was not expensive to build and that helped iacocca get the mustang the approval it needed to be built
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the people who ran the ford company did not want to take a chance on a car like that because they lost a lot of money on another car the edsel just a few years back
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it set sales records and became one of the best selling cars of all time
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it would remain mostly the same until 1966
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: so popular was the mustang that three ford assembly plants worked to build it
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: not only was the mustang built in dearborn but in metuchen new jersey and san jose california as well
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the very first mustang built to be sold to the public was a white convertible with a black interior and a v 8 engine
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it was purchased by a pilot from newfoundland
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: ford offered the one millionth mustang to the owner in exchange for the first one
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: that first mustang serial number 5f08f100001 is still on display at the henry ford museum in dearborn
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: its second body style came out in 1967 its third in 1969 and its fourth in 1971
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: bigger more powerful engines were offered starting in 1967 making some mustangs into musclecars
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: some of those special mustangs had special names such as mustang gt mach 1 boss 302 boss 351 boss 429 and 429 scj or super cobra jet by 1971 the mustang had become a much larger car
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the car grew in size so that ford could put its biggest engines in it but insurance companies were charging very high prices to insure powerful cars and sales began to drop
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: many people missed the original smaller mustang
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: a new mustang came out in 1974 called mustang ii and was based on the ford pinto although far less than the original car had been based on the falcon
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this new car was almost the same size as the original car but emissions controls and the arab oil embargo meant that the mustang ii was not a very powerful car
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: 1974 was not only the first time ford had built a car which looked like an older model it was also the first american car to be built on the metric system
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the short low hood meant that neither the inline six cylinder engine nor v 8 would fit so engine choices were changed to a 2.3 liter four cylinder engine built by ford in brazil and a more expensive v 6 engine built by ford in germany
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: a 5.0 liter v 8 engine was offered in 1975 which meant that ford engineers had to redesign much of the car to make it fit
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: no matter which engine was used the mustang ii was a heavier car than the 1964-66 model
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the mustang ii helped keep the ponycar alive between 1974 and 1978
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: general motors almost stopped building their popular chevrolet camaro and pontiac firebird chrysler corporation stopped building the dodge challenger and plymouth barracuda during that time
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: general motors stopped building the camaro in 2002 but they brought back a new version in 2009
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: chrysler brought back a new challenger in 2008 as well they like today's mustang are made to look like older models
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the new mustang that came out in 1979 may have been the most important mustang ever
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: one reason was the return of a powerful v 8 in 1982 which was developed in later years into an even more powerful engine
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the basic design carried all the way through the 2004 model year but with hundreds of thousands of improvements over the years
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: very few parts except for some minor chassis parts stayed unchanged
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the 2005 model was the first all new mustang since 1979
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: because the original mustang was and is one of the most popular cars ever ford made the new mustang coupe and convertible look very much like the first mustangs especially the 1967 and 1968 models
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the engines of the 2005 mustang were based on the older engines but had more power
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the 4.0-liter v6 engine made 210 hp and the 4.6-liter v8 300hp which rose to 315 hp on the 2008 bullitt
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: all models were available with manual and automatic transmissions
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: both ford and carroll shelby recently brought back the a new version of the very fast shelby gt 500 mustang in 2007
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: mr shelby helped create the special shelby gt 350 and gt 500 versions of the mustang beginning in 1965
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the 2007 shelby gt500 had a 5.4-liter v8 which produced 500 hp
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in 2008 a kr version with 540 hp was added
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the 2010 mustang in turn looks much like the 2005-09 model but all the body parts except for the roof are different
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the rear turn signals of the 2005-2010 cars blink in a one two three sequence like the 1967-68 mercury cougar and 1964-66 ford thunderbird
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: power for the v8 rose to 315 hp
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in 2011 the mustang received new engines a 3.7-liter v6 base engine with 305 hp and a new 5.0-liter engine with 412 hp
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: power on the shelby gt500 rose to 550 hp and later to 662 hp in 2013
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: a boss 302 performance version powered by a 444 hp v8 was introduced for 2012
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: for 2015 a completely new ford mustang will be introduced

lines.value: the thumb is one of the five fingers on the human hand
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: thumbs are different from the other four fingers because they are in a different direction have only 2 bones the others have 3 and are shorter
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: thumbs help us to pick things up
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this is called having opposable thumbs
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: all primate s have thumbs but only humans have fully opposable thumbs
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: thumbs have an artery in them
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: arteries have a pulse
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this is why we should not take other peoples pulses with our thumbs
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: intersex variations occur though rarely in species which use sexual reproduction
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: intersex people are born with sex characteristics that lie between those of typical males and typical females
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: older terms include the word hermaphrodite but this term is now only used for animals which have both natural male and female organs
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the clinical term disorders of sex development dsds is very controversial
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: an individual's genitalia may be atypical in some way
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it can be difficult to determine if an intersex baby is genetically male or female with xy chromosomes or xx chromosomes
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: they may also have male and or female secondary sex characteristics such as body shape
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: however there is a wide range of variation in sexual anatomy
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: there are many more subtle forms of sex anatomy or sex chromosome differences
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: these don't even show physically
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: some won't show up until later in life
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: sometimes the variation may appear when the baby reaches puberty or becomes an adult
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: up to 1.7% of people may be born with an intersex variation
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: a child born with genitalia atypical enough to call in an expert occurs in about 1 of 1500 births
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: more information on the frequency of different causes is available
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: most causes of intersex are congenital
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: that means people are born with it usually because of a genetic condition
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: all development is governed by genes which regulate the process of growth
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the most common intersex variation is a hormone condition
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this causes genetically female fetuses to have a more maasculine body appearance because the babies adrenal gland produces higher levels of androgen hormones hormones that act like testosterone
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this may cause the female baby to appear male even to doctors and parents
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: surgery may be used on intersex babies to give a more usual cosmetic appearance
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: this is sometimes thought to make children more normal but this idea lacks evidence and is contested
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: early cosmetic medical interventions can lead to problems in later life including decreased sexual function and sensation
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the children concerned cannot consent to those surgeries and their parents may not understand the full implications
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: there is no medical consensus about surgical interventions including their type timing necessity and conduct
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: civil society organizations and human rights experts have called for an end to medical interventions on intersex children that are carried out for social reasons
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: united nations and other human rights experts regard these medical treatments as harmful
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in 2011 christiane volling became the first intersex person known to win a legal case taken because of non consensual surgical intervention
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in april 2015 malta became the first country to end medical interventions to modify the sex anatomy of intersex children
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: several countries protect intersex people from discrimination including south africa australia and malta
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: jackson pollock january 28 1912 - august 11 1956 was an american painter
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he became famous for painting in the abstract expressionist style
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: pollock's most famous paintings were made by dripping and splashing paint on a large canvas
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: his nickname was jack the dripper
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: because of the method this style is often called action painting
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: pollock was helped by his wife artist lee krasner and her style was very new at the time
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: pollock was bitter and had serious drinking problems with alcohol
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: his paintings are in museums all over the world and his work is rated very high
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: pollock has been the subject of many movies because of his interesting life
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: the most famous was a short documentary movie directed by hans namuth in 1951 and the 2000 movie about his life called pollock made by and starring actor ed harris
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: pollock was born in cody wyoming
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in 1956 he was killed in a car crash in springs new york at the age of 44
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: pollock was introduced to the use of liquid paint in 1936 at an experimental workshop operated in new york city by the mexican muralist david alfaro siqueiros
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he later used paint pouring as one of several techniques on canvases of the early 1940s such as male and female and composition with pouring i after his move to springs new york he began painting with his canvases laid out on the studio floor and he developed what was later called his technique
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: pollock described this use of household paints instead of artist's paints as a natural growth out of a need
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he used hardened brushes sticks and even basting syringes as paint applicators
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: with this technique pollock was able to achieve a more immediate means of creating art the paint now literally flowing from his chosen tool onto the canvas
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: by defying the convention of painting on an upright surface he added a new dimension literally by being able to view and apply paint to his canvases from all directions
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: later pollock turned to synthetic resinbased paints called alkyd enamels which at that time was a novel medium
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: in 1956 time magazine called pollock jack the dripper as a result of his unique painting style
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: pollock's no
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: 5 1948 stands at the fifth highest price ever for a work of art
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: it was privately sold by sotheby's for price adjusted us$163.8 million dollars

lines.value: he failed the eleven plus exam

lines.value: baker became a monk when he was 15

lines.value: when he decided to change his life he first worked in the royal army medical corps and then as a construction worker
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he took up acting first as a hobby then professionally
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: his first big part was as grigori rasputin in the 1971 movie nicholas and alexandra
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: baker is best known for playing the fourth doctor in the long running science fiction television series doctor who
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he played this role from 1974 to 1981
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: when he got the job he was working on a building site because it was hard to find work as an actor

lines.value: he is famous for playing the doctor longer than any other actor

lines.value: his version of the character is probably the best remembered by many people

lines.value: as he thought of himself as a role model for children he would always pretend to be the doctor in real life and sign autographs for them

lines.value: he did not like to see too much violence in doctor who
lines.name: Simple English

lines.value: he once changed the script so the doctor threatened a character with a jelly baby instead of a knife

lines.value: he was a narrator for the comedy sketch show little britain
